sentences.english: The system can even be used to spot rip currents in real time.
sentences.chinese: 这个系统甚至可以捕捉到实时的海流活动。

sentences.english: And yet, the writing life continues to capture its victims.
sentences.chinese: 但是，写作的生活将继续捕捉爱好它的“落网之鱼”。

sentences.english: If in capture wind clear rain and dew natural environment peony's sentiment condition .
sentences.chinese: 如捕捉风晴雨露自然环境中牡丹的情态。

sentences.english: Masking a trace helps to minimize the amount of information that is captured.
sentences.chinese: 通过屏蔽跟踪，有助于减少所捕捉的信息量。

sentences.english: So that is my goal, to capture the fantastic details hidden in these natural wonders.
sentences.chinese: 捕捉匿藏在这些自然奇景中的奇异细节正是我的目标。

sentences.english: Next step, figure out how to capture and communicate those changes.
sentences.chinese: 下一步，估计如何捕捉和沟通这些变化。

sentences.english: The fish are rising; perhaps we'll catch one.
sentences.chinese: 鱼浮上水面来了，也许我们能捕捉一条。

sentences.english: The wind tower is a system for capturing air currents with openings at the top facing the prevailing winds.
sentences.chinese: 风塔是一种顶部开口，面向主风，捕捉气流的系统。

sentences.english: We set this error when catching the exceptions.
sentences.chinese: 我们在捕捉到异常时设置此错误。

sentences.english: When a proton recaptures an electron, red light is frequently emitted.
sentences.chinese: 当一个质子再度捕捉到电子时，常常会辐射出红光。

sentences.english: For example, a reader may also capture the temperature or radioactivity of an item.
sentences.chinese: 例如，读取器也可以捕捉物品的温度或放射能。

sentences.english: Capturing such a beautiful moment can be exciting as well as a fun activity.
sentences.chinese: 捕捉到如此美丽的一刻既令人激动，又饶有兴味。

sentences.english: ATRAP, in contrast, captures about five million positrons.
sentences.chinese: 相较之下，ATRAP可以捕捉到约500万个正子。

sentences.english: You will need a TV Tuner card to capture the TV signal on your computer.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一个电视卡捕捉电视信号在计算机上。

sentences.english: The rat-catcher can't catch caught rats.
sentences.chinese: 捕鼠器不能捕捉已被逮住的老鼠。
没有轻触，只有捕捉和吞噬。

definition: to follow a trail/to trace/to pursue
to prey on/to catch and feed on/to hunt for food
to grasp (also fig.)/to seize/to hold/assurance/certainty/sure (of the outcome)
to follow sb's tracks/to tail/to shadow/tracking
